com.smartnsoft.droid4me

Interface LifeCycle

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Smartable<AggregateClass>, SmartableActivity<AggregateClass>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSmartListActivity, AbstractWrappedSmartListActivity, Droid4mizer, ForBusinessObjectActivity, SimpleWrappedListView, SmartActionBarActivity, SmartActivity, SmartDialogFragment, SmartDialogFragment, SmartFragment, SmartFragment, SmartFragmentActivity, SmartGroupActivity, SmartListActivity, SmartListViewFragment, SmartListViewFragment, SmartMapActivity, SmartPreferenceActivity, SmartPreferenceFragment, SmartSplashScreenActivity, SmartTabActivity, WrappedListView, WrappedSmartListActivity

    public interface LifeCycle
    Identifies a typical life cycle work-flow for an activity or a fragment of the framework. When referring to the Activity "life cycle", we do not consider the entity instance re-creation due to configuration changes, for instance. The framework capture those entities work-flow and divides it into typical actions:
    1. set the layout and extract the key widgets,
    2. retrieve the business objects are represented on the entity,
    3. bind the entity widgets to the previously extracted business objects,
    4. when an Activity has been stacked over the current entity task, and the navigation comes back to the entity, refresh the widgets with the potential business objects new values.

    When deriving from this interface, just implement this interface method. You do not need to override the traditional Activity Activity.onCreate(Bundle)/Activity.onStart()/Activity.onResume() method nor the Fragment Fragment.onCreate(Bundle)/Fragment.onStart()/Fragment.onResume() methods, even if you still are allowed to.

    The onXXX methods should never be invoked because they are callbacks, and that only the framework should invoke them during the entity life cycle!

    In the code, the interface methods are sorted in chronological order of invocation by the framework.

    Since:
    2008.05.18
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy
      Deprecated. 
      use LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicyAnnotation instead
      static interface  LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicyAnnotation
      Same concept as LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy, but through an annotation.
      static class  LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException
      This exception should be triggered on the framework methods which allow to throw it, when a business object is not accessible.

      Methods

      Asks the implementing entity to reload its business objects and to synchronize its display.

    • Method Detail

      • onRetrieveDisplayObjects

        void onRetrieveDisplayObjects()
        This is the place where the derived class should set its layout, extract all widgets which require a further customization and store them as instance attributes. This method is invoked only once during the entity life cycle.

        The method is invoked:

        • for an Activity, during the Activity#onCreate() execution, after the parent Activity#onCreate() method has been invoked ;
        • for an Fragment, during the Fragment#onCreate() execution, after the parent Fragment#onCreate() method has been invoked.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

      • onRetrieveBusinessObjects

        void onRetrieveBusinessObjects()
                               throws LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException
        This is the place where to load the business objects, from memory, local persistence, via web services, necessary for the entity processing.

        If the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, this callback will be invoked from a background thread, and not the UI thread. This method will be invoked a first time once the entity has successfully retrieved its display objects, and every time the refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable, boolean) method is invoked.

        When the method is invoked the first time, if the entity does not implement the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, its execution will occur:

        • for an Activity, during the Activity.onResume() execution, after the parent Activity.onResume() method has been invoked ;
        • for an Fragment, during the Fragment.onResume() execution, after the parent Fragment.onResume() method has been invoked.
        When the method is invoked the first time, if the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, it is ensured that this method will be invoked at least after the entity onResume() execution has started.

        It is NOT ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread: if the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, it is ensured to be invoked from a background thread, otherwise, it is ensured to be invoked from the UI thread.

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Throws:
        LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException - if the extraction of the business objects was a failure and that this issue cannot be recovered, this enables to notify the framework that the current entity cannot continue its execution

      • onBusinessObjectsRetrieved

        void onBusinessObjectsRetrieved()
        This is the typical callback that will be invoked every time the business objects have been retrieved, just after the onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method has successfully completed, i.e. no LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException exception has been thrown. It is strongly advised not to modify the GUI during this method execution.

        It is NOT ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread! If the Activity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, this method will be invoked from a (high-priority) worker thread.

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

      • onFulfillDisplayObjects

        void onFulfillDisplayObjects()
        This is the place where the implementing class can initialize the previously retrieved graphical objects. This method is invoked only once during the entity life cycle.

        If the entity does not implement the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, the method is invoked during the:

        1. Activity.onResume() execution for the Activity, after the parent Activity.onResume() method has been invoked,
        2. Fragment.onResume() execution for the Fragment, after the parent Fragment.onResume() method has been invoked.
        If the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, this method will be invoked just after the onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method first invocation has successfully returned.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

      • onSynchronizeDisplayObjects

        void onSynchronizeDisplayObjects()
        This method is supposed to update the display objects that may need some refreshing due to the underlying business objects that may have changed. It will be invoked a first time once the entity has successfully fulfilled its display objects, and every time the refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable, boolean) method is invoked, provided the previous onRetrieveBusinessObjects() callback has successfully executed.

        When the method is invoked the first time, it will be called just after the onFulfillDisplayObjects() callback execution.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

      • refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay

        void refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean retrieveBusinessObjects,
                                    java.lang.Runnable onOver,
                                    boolean immediately)
        Asks the implementing entity to reload its business objects and to synchronize its display. The method invokes the onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method and then, provided the previous call was successful, the onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method.

        It must be invoked only from the UI thread, if the current interface does not implement the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface.

        Parameters:
        retrieveBusinessObjects - indicates whether the onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method should be invoked or not
        onOver - if not null, this method will be eventually invoked from the UI thread, once the onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method execution has successfully completed
        immediately - if this flag is set to true, even if the implementing entity is not currently displayed, the execution will be run at once. If set to false, the execution will be delayed until the entity (Activity.onResume() for the Activity, Fragment.onResume() for the Fragment method is invoked
